alert.note: Alert for Bertie; Chowan (North Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Wakefield (Eastern Virginia and Southern Maryland)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued July 24 at 5:58PM EDT by NWS Wakefield
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Bertie and southwestern Chowan Counties through 645 PM EDT... At 558 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm 9 miles southwest of Valhalla, or 10 miles east of Windsor, moving east southeast at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph. In addition, Doppler radar has indicated weak rotation with this storm. While a tornado is not immediately likely, remain alert for any warnings. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. This storm will remain over mainly rural areas of east central Bertie and southwestern Chowan Counties, including the following locations... Saint Johns, Merry Hill, Midway and Edenhouse. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...45 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
